items.title: _MoJ_ Cloud Platform
items.body: "The MoJ Cloud Platform (CP) is a kubernetes cluster, running in the “moj-cp” Amazon AWS account, inside a Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) which isolates the cluster and the AWS resources used by services running in the cluster. https://user-guide.cloud-platform.service.justice.gov.uk/documentation/concepts/cp-overview.html#cloud-platform-overview"

items.title: .NET
items.body: .NET Framework is a software framework developed by Microsoft that runs primarily on Microsoft Windows. It includes a large class library named as Framework Class Library and provides language interoperability across several programming languages.

items.title: Angular
items.body: A platform for building mobile and desktop web applications.

items.title: App - JBoss (WildFly)
items.body: "WildFly, formerly known as JBoss is a Java EE application server authored by JBoss, now developed by Red Hat. Open-source with optional Red Hat support."

items.title: App - Tomcat
items.body: "Apache Tomcat is an open-source implementation of the Java Servlet, JavaServer Pages, Java Expression Language and WebSocket technologies."

items.title: App - Weblogic
items.body: Oracle WebLogic Server is a Java EE application server currently developed by Oracle Corporation.

items.title: Auth - Keycloak
items.body: An open source software product to allow single sign-on with Identity Management and Access Management aimed at modern applications and services.

items.title: AWS - Beanstalk
items.body: "An easy-to-use service for deploying and scaling web applications and services developed with Java, .NET, PHP, Node.js, Python, Ruby, Go, and Docker on familiar servers such as Apache, Nginx, Passenger, and IIS."

items.title: AWS - EC2
items.body: "Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) is a web service that provides secure, resizable compute capacity in the cloud. Virtual Machines on-demand."

items.title: AWS - ECR (private repo)
items.body: "Amazon Elastic Container Registry (ECR) is a fully-managed Docker container registry that makes it easy for developers to store, manage, and deploy Docker container images."

items.title: AWS - ECS
items.body: "A fully managed container orchestration service. Customers such as Duolingo, Samsung, GE, and Cook Pad use ECS to run their most sensitive and mission critical applications because of its security, reliability, and scalability."

items.title: AWS - ElastiCache Redis
items.body: "A fully managed Redis and Memcached. Seamlessly deploy, operate, and scale popular open source compatible in-memory data. A blazing fast in-memory data store that provides sub-millisecond latency to power internet-scale real-time applications."

items.title: AWS - Localstack (Dev)
items.body: A fully functional local AWS cloud stack. Develop and test your cloud & Serverless apps offline!

items.title: AWS - S3
items.body: "Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) is an object storage service that offers industry-leading scalability, data availability, security, and performance."

items.title: AWS - Serverless
items.body: "Serverless is the native architecture of the cloud that enables you to shift more of your operational responsibilities to AWS, increasing your agility and innovation. Serverless allows you to build and run applications and services without thinking about servers. It eliminates infrastructure management tasks such as server or cluster provisioning, patching, operating system maintenance, and capacity provisioning."

items.title: AWS - SNS
items.body: "Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) is a highly available, durable, secure, fully managed pub/sub messaging service that enables you to decouple microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications."

items.title: AWS - SQS
items.body: "Amazon Simple Queue Service (SQS) is a fully managed message queuing service that enables you to decouple and scale microservices, distributed systems, and serverless applications."

items.title: AWS Public Cloud
items.body: "Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a comprehensive cloud platform, offering over 175 fully featured services from data centers globally."

items.title: C#
items.body: "A general-purpose, multi-paradigm programming language encompassing strong typing, lexically scoped, imperative, declarative, functional, generic, object-oriented, and component-oriented programming disciplines. Typically used with .NET."

items.title: CI - Circle CI
items.body: "Cloud hosted CI tool providing a continuous integration and continuous delivery platform to build, test, and deploy software."

items.title: CI - Jenkins
items.body: "An open source automation server which enables developers around the world to reliably build, test, and deploy their software."

items.title: Code - Github
items.body: "A development platform inspired by the way you work. From open source to business, you can host and review code, manage projects, and build software alongside 40 million developers. "

items.title: Code - Prettier
items.body: An opinionated code formatter; Supports many languages; Integrates with most editors.

items.title: Code - SASS
items.body: "CSS with superpowers. Sass is the most mature, stable, and powerful professional grade CSS extension language in the world."

items.title: Code - Sonarqube
items.body: "An open-source platform developed by SonarSource for continuous inspection of code quality to perform automatic reviews with static analysis of code to detect bugs, code smells, and security vulnerabilities on 20+ programming languages."

items.title: DB - ADO
items.body: "ActiveX Data Objects (ADO) is a high-level, easy-to-use interface to OLE DB."

items.title: DB - Cloud Managed DBs
items.body: "Managed databases are typically provided by the cloud provider as-a-Service and takes over many of the difficult or tedious management tasks of a managing a database. It is typically scalable, manages backups, software patching, automatic failure detection, and recovery."

items.title: DB - Flyway
items.body: "Version control for your database. Robust schema evolution across all your environments. With ease, pleasure and plain SQL."

items.title: DB - Postgres RDS
items.body: "With Amazon RDS, you can deploy scalable PostgreSQL deployments in minutes with cost-efficient and resizable hardware capacity. Amazon RDS manages complex and time-consuming administrative tasks such as PostgreSQL software installation and upgrades; storage management; replication for high availability and read throughput; and backups for disaster recovery."

items.title: DB - SQL Clone
items.body: A database provisioning tool that lets you create full copies of SQL Server databases and backups in seconds

items.title: Demo 2
items.body: This is a revision of the 2nd demo item. It moved from trail to adopt.

revisions.body: This is a demo entry. It is used to show how a radar item is written in Markdown format. The meta header is used to define the attributes of the item. The content of the file is used as the description of the item.

items.title: Demo 3
items.body: This is a demo entry. It is used to show how a radar item is written in Markdown format. The meta header is used to define the attributes of the item. The content of the file is used as the description of the item.

items.title: Demo 4
items.body: This is a new demo entry. Items can link to other items and replaces the old links with a html extension to the new link structure, whereas a new link should be untouched.

revisions.body: This is a new demo entry. Items can link to other items.

items.title: Dev - Docker-compose
items.body: "(Dev only - not for Production use). A tool for defining and running multi-container Docker applications. With Compose, you use a YAML file to configure your application's services."

items.title: Dev - Gradle (Groovy-based)
items.body: An open-source build automation system that builds upon the concepts of Apache Ant and Apache Maven and introduces a Groovy or Kotlin -based domain-specific language instead of the XML form used by Apache Maven for declaring the project configuration.

items.title: Dev - Gradle (Kotlin-based)
items.body: An open-source build automation system that builds upon the concepts of Apache Ant and Apache Maven and introduces a Groovy or Kotlin -based domain-specific language instead of the XML form used by Apache Maven for declaring the project configuration.

items.title: Dev - IntelliJ
items.body: "A cross-platform IDE/source code editor primarily aimed at JVM-based technologies such as Java, Groovy, Kotlin, and Scala but it also supports Java EE and web development. An open-source version is available under the name IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition, and a proprietary version as IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate Edition. IntelliJ IDEA Ultimate Edition can be made to include the feature set of PhpStorm, PyCharm and RubyMine via plugins. "

items.title: Dev - Make
items.body: A tool which controls the generation of executables and other non-source files of a program from the program's source files.

items.title: Dev - Postman
items.body: A collaboration platform for API development. Postman's features simplify each step of building an API and streamline collaboration so you can create better APIs - faster.

items.title: Dev - SBT (Scala build tool)
items.body: "An open-source build tool for Scala and Java projects, similar to Java's Maven and Ant."

items.title: Dev - VSCode
items.body: "A source-code editor developed by Microsoft for Windows, Linux and macOS. It includes support for debugging, embedded Git control and GitHub, syntax highlighting, intelligent code completion, snippets, and code refactoring."

items.title: Docker Hub (public)
items.body: A container repository service for finding and sharing container images with your team. It provides the following major features: Repositories: Push and pull container images. ... Webhooks: Trigger actions after a successful push to a repository to integrate Docker Hub with other services.

items.title: Geb
items.body: "A very Groovy browser automation. Web Testing, Screen Scraping and more."

items.title: GoLang
items.body: "An open source programming language that makes it easy to build simple, reliable, and efficient software. "

items.title: Groovy
items.body: "A powerful, optionally typed and dynamic language, with static-typing and static compilation capabilities, for the Java platform aimed at improving developer productivity thanks to a concise, familiar and easy to learn syntax. It integrates smoothly with any Java program, and immediately delivers to your application powerful features, including scripting capabilities, Domain-Specific Language authoring, runtime and compile-time meta-programming and functional programming. "

items.title: IaC - Ansible (VMs only)
items.body: "An open-source software provisioning, configuration management, and application-deployment tool. It runs on many Unix-like systems, and can configure both Unix-like systems as well as Microsoft Windows. It includes its own declarative language to describe system configuration."

items.title: IaC - Terraform
items.body: "Use Infrastructure as Code to provision and manage any cloud, infrastructure, or service. Write declarative configuration files, Plan and predict changes, Create reproducible infrastructure."

items.title: IaC - Terragrunt
items.body: A thin wrapper for Terraform that provides extra tools for working with multiple Terraform modules. - gruntwork-io/terragrunt.

items.title: Java
items.body: "A powerful general-purpose programming language. It is used to develop desktop and mobile applications, big data processing, embedded systems, and so on."

items.title: Java - JPA
items.body: A Java API specification that describes the management of relational data in applications. Java Persistence API (also Jakarta Persistence).

items.title: Javascript (JS)
items.body: "JavaScript, often abbreviated as JS, is a programming language that conforms to the ECMAScript specification. JavaScript is high-level, often just-in-time compiled, and multi-paradigm. It has curly-bracket syntax, dynamic typing, prototype-based object-orientation, and first-class functions"

items.title: JS - Browserify
items.body: An open-source JavaScript tool that allows developers to write Node.js-style modules that compile for use in the browser.

items.title: JS - Chai (testing)
items.body: A BDD / TDD assertion library for node and the browser that can be delightfully paired with any javascript testing framework.

items.title: JS - Cypress (testing)
items.body: A JavaScript End to End Testing Framework

items.title: JS - ES Lint
items.body: A pluggable and configurable linter tool for identifying and reporting on patterns in JavaScript. Maintain your code quality with ease.

items.title: JS - Grunt
items.body: "A JavaScript task runner, a tool used to automatically perform frequent tasks such as minification, compilation, unit testing, and linting."

items.title: JS - Gulp
items.body: "A toolkit for automating painful or time-consuming tasks in your javascript development workflow, so you can stop messing around and build something. "

items.title: JS - Jest (testing)
items.body: "A delightful JavaScript Testing Framework with a focus on simplicity. It works with projects using: Babel, TypeScript, Node, React, Angular, Vue and more!"

items.title: JS - Mocha (testing)
items.body: "A feature-rich JavaScript test framework running on Node.js and in the browser, making asynchronous testing simple and fun. Mocha tests run serially, allowing for flexible and accurate reporting, while mapping uncaught exceptions to the correct test cases."

items.title: JS - Nunjucks
items.body: "A more sophisticated templating engine for JavaScript. Rich Powerful language with block inheritance, autoescaping, macros, asynchronous control, and more. Heavily inspired by jinja2."

items.title: JS - Sinon (testing)
items.body: "Standalone test spies, stubs and mocks for JavaScript. Works with any unit testing framework."

items.title: JS - Standard JS
items.body: "A JavaScript style guide, linter, and formatter"

items.title: JS - Typescript
items.body: A typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript.

items.title: JS - Webpack
items.body: "A module bundler. Its main purpose is to bundle JavaScript files for usage in a browser, yet it is also capable of transforming, bundling, or packaging"

items.title: JS - Yarn
items.body: A package manager that doubles down as project manager.

items.title: Kotlin (London)
items.body: "A modern programming language that makes developers happier. Good for Mobile cross-platform, Native, Data science, Server-side, Web development, Android. Kotlin is Concise, Safe, Interoperable with existing libraries for the JVM, Android, and the browser and Tool-friendly."

items.title: Kotlin (Sheffield)
items.body: "A modern programming language that makes developers happier. Good for Mobile cross-platform, Native, Data science, Server-side, Web development, Android. Kotlin is Concise, Safe, Interoperable with existing libraries for the JVM, Android, and the browser and Tool-friendly."

items.title: Monitoring - App Insights
items.body: "A feature of Azure Monitor - an extensible Application Performance Management (APM) service for developers and DevOps professionals. Use it to monitor your live applications. It will automatically detect performance anomalies, and includes powerful analytics tools."

items.title: Monitoring - Grafana
items.body: An open source analytics & monitoring solution for every database.

items.title: Monitoring - Pager Duty
items.body: A real-time operations platform providing on-call management and incident response. Less downtime and fewer outages means happier customers and more productive teams.

items.title: Monitoring - Pingdom
items.body: Monitor your website's availability and performance with Pingdom and always be the first to know when your website is down.

items.title: Monitoring - Prometheus (inc Alert Mgr)
items.body: "An open-source monitoring system with a dimensional data model, flexible query language, efficient time series database and modern alerting approach."

items.title: Monitoring - Sentry
items.body: "An error monitoring tool that helps software teams discover, triage, and prioritize errors in real-time."

items.title: Next.js
items.body: "An opinionated framework that simplifies routing, renders on the server side by default and streamlines dependencies and builds."

items.title: Node.js
items.body: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine.

items.title: Node.js - Express
items.body: A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications and APIs.

items.title: PHP
items.body: "A server scripting language, and a powerful tool for making dynamic and interactive Web pages."

items.title: Platform - Docker
items.body: "A lightweight, standalone, executable package of software that includes everything needed to run an application: code, runtime, system tools, system libraries and settings."

items.title: PLSQL
items.body: A combination of SQL along with the procedural features of programming languages. It was developed by Oracle Corporation in the early 90's to enhance the capabilities of SQL.

items.title: PowerShell
items.body: "A task-based command-line shell and scripting language built on . NET. PowerShell helps system administrators and power-users rapidly automate tasks that manage operating systems (Linux, macOS, and Windows) and processes."

items.title: Python (London)
items.body: A programming language that lets you work quickly and integrate systems more effectively.

items.title: Quay Docker Repo
items.body: "A container repository service that [builds, analyzes, distributes] your container images"

items.title: React for static
items.body: A progressive static-site generator for React.

items.title: React.js
items.body: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces

items.title: Ruby (London)
items.body: "A dynamic, open source programming language with a focus on simplicity and productivity. It has an elegant syntax that is natural to read and easy to write."

items.title: Ruby (Sheffield)
items.body: "A modern programming language that makes developers happier. Good for Mobile cross-platform, Native, Data science, Server-side, Web development, Android. Kotlin is Concise, Safe, Interoperable with existing libraries for the JVM, Android, and the browser and Tool-friendly."

items.title: Ruby Rails
items.body: A web-application framework that includes everything needed to create database-backed web applications according to the Model-View-Controller (MVC).

items.title: Rust
items.body: A language empowering everyone to build reliable and efficient software.

items.title: Scala
items.body: "Scala combines object-oriented and functional programming in one concise, high-level language. Scala's static types help avoid bugs in complex applications, and its JVM and JavaScript runtimes let you build high-performance systems with easy access to huge ecosystems of libraries."

items.title: Security - OWASP ZAP
items.body: An open-source web application security scanner. It is intended to be used by both those new to application security as well as professional penetration testers. It is one of the most active Open Web Application Security Project projects and has been given Flagship status.

items.title: Security - Snyk
items.body: "Helps you use open source and stay secure. Continuously find and fix vulnerabilities for npm, Maven, NuGet, RubyGems, PyPI and much more."

items.title: Selenium
items.body: "A portable framework for testing web applications. Selenium provides a playback tool for authoring functional tests without the need to learn a test scripting language (Selenium IDE). ... The tests can then run against most modern web browsers. Selenium runs on Windows, Linux"

items.title: Spring Boot
items.body: "A Java-based framework which makes it easy to create stand-alone, production-grade Spring based Applications that you can ""just run""."
